TextView.android:text: You need to choose a place that you are extremely familiar with. For example, as one of my memory palaces, I have chosen my childhood home:/n/n 1) I have a strong visual memory of it /n/n 2) it has lots of different places that I can 'see' things being placed or happening. /n/n When you need to remember a sequence of items (let's say of order consequence), start by imagining yourself walking through your 'memory palace'. At the front door, I would 'place' my first item to remember. When you place something, you want to take a moment to make the memory memorable, or ridiculous. Let's say I want to remember a grocery list, and the first item in the list is cottage cheese./n/n I might imagine an oversized tub of cottage cheese that a child is messily playing in in front of my front door. In the kitchen, I might imagine my father, who loves to cook, wrestling with a live chicken that he wanted to prepare for dinner. Under the kitchen table, etc. /n/n
